ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Sure. I'll recommend it to a new student who want to do biology related researches.I learn some fundamental knowledge of biology. And I got a basic idea of how biological researches is conducted.

This course was supposed to be a crash course in biology/biochemistry where the students were exposed to various methods used in current research as well as current topics of research. I would not recommend this course though. It would be more beneficial for students to take an actual introductory biology course or biochemistry course.

This course is a great overview of relevant topics in biology research at Yale; while it should not be expected to be a theoretical class in biology, it is very helpful as a tool discussing the leading edges of research interest and the fundamentals behind them. I would recommend this especially to students with little biology research experience.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It's very important for me to have more knowledge in biology. And this course helps me a lot.
